other_tests.findings: Unusually slow atrial flutter conducted 1:1 to the ventricles with hypotension during exertion. Prolonged QRS duration, sinus node dysfunction, high-degree atrioventricular block, and normal QT interval after catheter ablation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: P-wave duration, PR interval, and QRS duration were progressively prolonged with age (3 weeks to 12 weeks).

other_tests.findings: Normal echocardiography during initial presentation, but later observations indicated end-diastolic and end-systolic left ventricular dilatation and reduced fractional shortening.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Statistically significant dilatation and reduction in left ventricular fractional shortening observed at 12 weeks compared to earlier assessments.

other_tests.findings: No significant fibrosis or myocyte disarray was noted.
Reduction in sodium channel protein abundance associated with the DN allele.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Changes in sodium channel protein levels corresponded with the presence of DN alleles, but specifics on progression over time are not provided.

other_tests.findings: Marked reduction in sodium current amplitude in DN mice compared to controls.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Consistent changes in gating observed, including increased late sodium current in DN/DN mice compared to DN/H and H/H littermates.
